info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 9:07AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Ouachita River At Felsenthal Lock and Dam affecting Union and Ashley Counties.
For the Ouachita River...including Felsenthal Lock and Dam... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ouachita River at Felsenthal Lock and Dam.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 70.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of the Felsenthal National Wildlife Refuge will continue for several days. Secondary roadways along the river bottom will be inundated and closed. At 81.0 feet, Moderate flooding of county roadways and bridges will continue for several days. Detours are necessary and travel in and around the area will be difficult.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 65.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 65.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue rising to 82.0 feet April 20th. - Flood stage is 70.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
